item.title: Amazon Music’s new AI feature lets you browse podcast episodes by topic
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Amazon Music announced Tuesday the launch of its new AI-powered feature, “Topics,” which allows users to explore podcast episodes by specific topics discussed in the episode.  When you visit the page of a podcast episode, look for new Topic tags below the episode description. You can tap on a tag to see a list of […]

item.title: Apple Intelligence’s writing tools stumble on swears and controversial topics
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Apple's Writing Tools feature will show a message notifying you that AI-generated suggestions might not be of the highest quality when tackling certain topics.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Flighty’s popular flight-tracking app can now predict delays using machine learning
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
Popular flight tracking app Flighty is releasing a new version on Tuesday that uses machine learning and aviation authority data to provide early warnings of delays and give users the exact reason behind delays.  With the launch of Flight 4.0, the app tracks the two biggest causes of delays—late aircraft and airspace issues—to inform users […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: TechCrunch Minute: With Venu Sports, streaming gets serious about live sports
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
Live sports are finally moving onto streaming in a serious way, with a new service called Venu Sports set to launch this fall. This is a joint venture between Disney and Fox (which are part of the same company), as well as Warner Bros. Discovery. It will include 14 live sports channels, including the various […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Chromecast is dead. Meet Google TV Streamer
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Google revealed its newest set-top streaming box, Google TV Streamer, which will replace the Chromecast. It doubles as a smart home hub.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: X files antitrust suit against advertising groups over ‘systematic illegal boycott’
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
X Ceo Linda Yaccarino claims that GARM's "illegal behavior of these organizations and their executives cost X billions of dollars."

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Cyberattack knocks Mobile Guardian MDM offline and wipes thousands of student devices
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description:
Students that use school devices managed by Mobile Guardian have been unable to access their files for days following a cyberattack.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Enhance your startup’s success with the ScaleUp Program at TechCrunch Disrupt 2024
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description:
Are you a Series A to B startup looking to make a significant impact in the tech world? The ScaleUp Startups Exhibitor Program at TechCrunch Disrupt 2024 is your gateway to success. This program is designed to catapult your startup into the spotlight, connecting you with industry leaders, investors, and potential partners. Benefits of joining […]

item.title: Uber highlights autonomous vehicle efforts now that Tesla’s in its rearview mirror
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Uber is highlighting the success of its autonomous vehicle effort — likely to assuage investors concerned about incoming competition from Tesla.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Breaking up Google would offer a chance to remodel the web
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
Just for a minute, as we digest the information that Google has been found to operate an illegal monopoly, can you imagine a web without Google? An internet without Google Search, Chrome, Gmail, Maps and so on would — very obviously — be a different place. But would such a change have implications for utility […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: MuukTest is putting GenAI at the center of software QA testing
item.dc:creator: Ron Miller
item.description:
Every piece of software needs to go through software quality assurance testing. It usually involves a human tester creating a series of test cases, and then checking the software interface for bugs and other issues. On Tuesday, MuukTest, a Raleigh, North Carolina startup, announced a new AI agent designed to help build those tests in […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: After nine years, Google’s Nest Learning Thermostat gets an AI makeover
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
After nine long years, Google is finally refreshing the device that gave Nest its name. The company Tuesday announced the launch of the Nest Learning Thermostat 4, 13 years after the release of the original and nearly a decade after the Learning Thermostat 3. Google hopes this release will usher in a new era for […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Who cut the plant-based cheese? Plonts did with microbes, and it’s stinky
item.dc:creator: Christine Hall
item.description:
Plonts’ cheese is made from soybeans, one of the most efficient ways to grow protein. Soybeans themselves are not very flavorful, and that is where fermentation and aging, help Plonts to create flavor versus using natural flavors.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Hyperspace is building custom instances to accelerate database searches
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Hyperspace, a Tel Aviv-based startup, says its custom cloud instances for database searches can dramatically speed up queries.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: AI-powered water heater could banish cold showers and carbon pollution
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
Cala Systems’ water heater pairs an advanced heat pump with an AI-powered control system to forecast hot water demand.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Perceptive Space emerges from stealth with plans to improve space weather predictions
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
Rocket launch providers, satellite operators, and even aviation companies rely on accurate predictions about “space weather,” like solar flares and geomagnetic storms, to inform their operations. But this vital information is still supplied mainly by governments using inaccurate, older modeling techniques.  Perceptive Space, a Canadian startup that emerged from stealth on Tuesday, is looking to […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: PayPal makes quick guest-checkout solution Fastlane available to U.S. businesses
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
PayPal said on Tuesday that it is making its quick guest-checkout solution, Fastlane, available to all U.S. merchants after testing it with select businesses for a few months. Businesses will initially have to use the company’s payment processing services, such as PayPal Braintree or PayPal Complete Payments, to use Fastlane. The company first started testing […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Amazon’s India chief resigns amid intensifying competition
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Manish Tiwary, the head of Amazon’s India operations, is leaving the firm “to pursue an opportunity outside of the company” as the U.S. e-commerce giant grapples with mounting pressure from competitors in one of its crucial international markets, TechCrunch has confirmed. Tiwary, who took over as country manager in late 2020, is departing as Amazon […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: German computer scientists raise $30 million to help companies make sense of their data
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
It’s not easy for organizations to become data-driven, despite the aspirations many have to get there. Even orgs with data analytics teams often struggle to make effective use of their data. According to a recent Gartner survey, fewer than half of data and analytics leaders say their teams are effective in providing value to their […]

item.title: Figure’s new humanoid robot leverages OpenAI for natural speech conversations
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Figure 02 is outfitted with speakers and microphones to speak and listen to people at work.
